intro: Piper pseudopothifolium, commonly known as the golden piper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the rainforests of Brazil, particularly in the state of Pará. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
